Author: nostrademons
Content:
'Course, the Dow also sets records roughly half the time that the U.S. is not in a recession.

I do see some worrying signs - real estate for suburban Boston really is a bloodbath for sellers, the numbers on consumer debt remind me a lot of 1929, and some local restaurants seem to have reduced business lately. But if I had to make a call, I'd guess that we're midcycle now, at the beginning of a large boom.
